ygData.subject: Re: Question /new to the list
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I don t think logging out affects it either.  When I was doing the squad ring quest, I accidently gave the sherriff three Runnyeye warbeads and one
ygData.messageBody:
On Thu, 9 Sep 1999, Donny Dane wrote:

> Also, it doesn't seem to matter how many rings, up to three you give him,
> when you give him a total of 3, he will reward you. As long as you don't
> log, he seems to keep a running total for you. I gave him 5 the other day,
> got one reward. A few hours later, i dropped back by, with a single, just
> to see what would happen. He gave me the reward upon receipt of the ring.

I don't think logging out affects it either. When I was doing
the squad ring quest, I accidently gave the sherriff three
Runnyeye warbeads and one shattered warbead, thus not getting
credit for turning in four. After that I concentrated on orcs
in WC and just turned in belts for about a week. While in
Misty to turn in the belts, I killed a goblin to save someone
else and got a Runnyeye warbead. Curious to see if this would
qualify as my 4th, I turned it in and sure enough I got
experience for having turned in 4.

Btw, does anyone know how to raise faction with the clerics in
Rivervale? It's annoying having to use a faction raising
spell every time I want to recharge the ring. They took out
the faction gains/losses for recharging/getting the ring when
they made it no-drop. I suppose I could just destroy them and
get another from the marshall, but I don't want to lose the
ring if they ever raise the faction requirement to get it.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
